aor.spells
Class SpellUtils

java.lang.Object
  aor.spells.SpellUtils

public final class SpellUtils
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a bunch of useful helper methods that make spell creation easier

Jay

removeFromInventory

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack> removeFromInventory(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                                                                      org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack... items)
Equivalent to inventory.removeItem(items), except it checks to see if the player is in creative mode or has the freespells permission first

Parameters:
player - - the player to check
items - - the items to check for
Returns:
boolean - whether or not the items are in the player's inventory

getPlayerTarget

public static org.bukkit.entity.Player getPlayerTarget(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                                       boolean needsLineOfSight)
An easier to use version of getTarget(). It returns the player the player passed is currently looking at. It will return null if no player is close enough to where the player is pointing who is in the player's line of sight (only if needsLineOfSight is true).

Parameters:
player - - the player to find a target for.
needsLineOfSight - - whether or not the player returned needs to be in the player's line of sight.
Returns:
Player - the found player or null if none are found

getPlayerTarget

public static org.bukkit.entity.Player getPlayerTarget(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
An easier to use version of getTarget(). It returns the player the player passed is currently looking at. It will return null if no player is close enough to where the player is pointing who is in the player's line of sight.

Parameters:
player - - the player to find a target for.
Returns:
Player - the found player or null if none are found

getTarget

public static org.bukkit.entity.Entity getTarget(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity player,
                                                 int maxDistance,
                                                 double maxRadiansOff,
                                                 boolean needsLineOfSight,
                                                 java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> allowedEntityClasses)
Returns the entity the player is most closely looking at that meets the requirements passed in the arguments

Parameters:
player - - the player to find the target entity for
maxDistance - - the size of the cube to check for entities
maxRadiansOff - - the maximum number of raidans off of where the player is looking for the entity to still be considered
needsLineOfSight - - whether or not the player must be able to see the entity
allowedEntityClasses - - Only entities that are instances or subclasses of these classes will be considered.
Returns:

flavorText

public static boolean flavorText(org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                 java.lang.String text)
This method is used to make the formatting of text that spells send to players more standard, in addition to checking whether or not these messages are enabled in the config file in the first place. We hope to eventually have a way to do this for each player. This is the recommended way to send messages to players.

Parameters:
player - - the player to send messages to
text - - the message to send the player
Returns:
boolean - whether or not the message was sent
